content: mini bonfire finished measurements construction small mini bonfire this is a very quick easy project the basic idea logs 2 /5cm long flames 2 /5cm tall is that you are knitting i-cords logs and tall mini bonfire attaching fringe flames to them there are 2 log 2 5 /6 cm long flames 4 5 /11cm tall size options a small mini bonfire and a tall mini bonfire to make the tall mini bonfire you place yarn one i-cord log with flame fringe behind the for the logs i used worsted and sock yarn held small mini bonfire double worsted for the main brown color and sock for the red color i-cord for the flames i used yellow orange and grey in to make an i-cord you need 2 dpns cast on the worsted weight and split/untwisted the plys to required number of stitches knit one row make it curly/wavy i also used yellow and instead of turning your knitting to work the orange in sock have fun picking your colors wrong side slide the stitches from the top to thin strands will work best the bottom of the needle now move your needle to your left hand and knit the row again needles by picking up the yarn from the back your two double-pointed needles dpns in size us 2 knitting will eventually make a tube an i-cord is 2 75mm or desired size always worked on the right side video links abbreviations how to attach your flames like a fringe on a k = knit scarf st s = stitch es copyright 2025 by natasha hanson all rights reserved 1 small mini bonfire instructions please note that if you plan to make a tall bonfire you will also need to make a small one to go in front main logs make 2 cast on 4 sts knit 9 row of i-cord cast off hide both ends inside of log and trim carefully front small log make 1 cast on 2 sts knit 9 row of i-cord cast off hide both ends inside of log and trim carefully flames yarn you will need 3 groups of 3 thin strands of yarn roughly 8 /20cm in length see figure a you can use sock or fingering for this or for the wavy look you can untwist your thicker yarn s plies attaching i attach my yarn flames to the top middle of one of my bigger logs just like a fringe on a scarf see figure b shaping when done lightly lick the top of your thumb and first finger and twist the top a few times this should give the fire its shape you may need to trim it first i trim it keeping the shape in mind how to arrange your fire i put the big log with no flames directly behind the log with flames to help it stand see figure c then i take the small log and place it diagonally to one side figure d if
